title: Which organisations are responsible for the number of patients delayed?
analysis_commentary:
The overall pattern seen in the number of beds experiencing a delayed transfer of care is not uniformly replicated when looking at which organisations are responsible for the delay. There is a relatively flat trend in the number of patients delayed over time when the delay is due to NHS and social care organisations combined. There is, however, an upward trend in delays due to NHS or Social care organisations separately.

Between April 2011 and April 2017 there were 1,040 more beds experiencing a delay where the NHS was responsible, a 47% increase. Over the same period there were 1,092 more patients with a delay due to social care, representing a 95% increase.

Updated July 2017.
